channel.title: Space History on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Space History on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: James Lovell, the steady astronaut who brought Apollo 13 home safely, has died
item.description: Lovell was the first person to fly to the Moon twice.

item.title: Texas politicians warn Smithsonian it must not lobby to retain its space shuttle
item.description: Generating “…public resistance to the provision’s enforcement.”

item.title: Houston, you’ve got a space shuttle… only NASA won’t say which one
item.description: “The acting administrator has made an identification.”

item.title: Lunar Outpost celebrates release of Lego Moon Rover Space Vehicle
item.description: “I bet most engineers started out as a kid playing with Lego.”

item.title: Smithsonian Air and Space opens halls for “milestone” and “future” artifacts
item.description: John Glenn’s Friendship 7 returns as SpaceX and Blue Origin artifacts debut.

item.title: ‘Not that into peace doves’: The Apollo-Soyuz patch NASA rejected
item.description: Paul Calle thought he had represented the Apollo-Soyuz Test Project.

item.title: “It’s a heist”: Senator calls out Texas for trying to steal shuttle from Smithsonian
item.description: “The title of this amendment is ‘Houston, We Have a Problem.’”
